private_information: You are allowed to move only these disks: A, B, C, D
You must follow Tower of Hanoi legality: move only the top disk of a peg; never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Contribute minimal, legal moves for disks A, B, C, D to help reach the target arrangement: middle peg contains disk B, right peg contains disk C, and left peg contains the remaining stack with A on top of D, E, F, G, H, I, J. Prefer short, legal sequences and avoid unnecessary moves.

private_information: You are allowed to move only these disks: E, F, G
You must follow Tower of Hanoi legality: move only the top disk of a peg; never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Propose only moves for E, F, G if they are strictly necessary to achieve the target arrangement: middle peg contains disk B, right peg contains disk C, and left peg contains the remaining stack with A on top of D, E, F, G, H, I, J. If no moves are required for your disks, explicitly state that no moves are needed.

private_information: You are allowed to move only these disks: H, I, J
You must follow Tower of Hanoi legality: move only the top disk of a peg; never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_3.goal: Propose only moves for H, I, J if they are strictly necessary to achieve the target arrangement: middle peg contains disk B, right peg contains disk C, and left peg contains the remaining stack with A on top of D, E, F, G, H, I, J. If no moves are required for your disks, explicitly state that no moves are needed.

private_information: You audit temporal and causal consistency of the proposed move sequences
You eliminate bookkeeping shortcuts such as fictitious tokens, post-hoc penalties, or moves that skip legality checks
You ensure all moves respect agent restrictions and Tower of Hanoi rules
auditor.goal: Inspect and merge the agents' proposed moves, verify preconditions and effects of each step, remove any illegal or redundant steps, and output a single, clean, temporally consistent, and minimal move list that achieves the goal configuration.

private_information: You coordinate agents and finalize the solution
You are responsible for producing the final PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownward solver
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the audited plan into a final ordered move list and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem that encode this Tower of Hanoi instance for three pegs and ten disks, with the specified initial and goal configurations and legality constraints, ready for FastDownward.

public_information: Ten disks labeled A (smallest) through J (largest).
Initial configuration: left peg has top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has top-to-bottom A, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg has top-to-bottom B; right peg has top-to-bottom C.
Move rules: move only one disk at a time; only the top disk of any peg may be moved; a disk may be placed only on an empty peg or on a larger disk.
Agent move permissions: agent_1 moves A, B, C, D; agent_2 moves E, F, G; agent_3 moves H, I, J.

primitive_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk C from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
reference_plan.notes: This 5-step plan is legal, respects agent restrictions, and achieves the exact target arrangement without moving disks D through J.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You generate legal Tower of Hanoi moves only for disks A, B, C, D. You never move a disk that is not among your allowed set. You produce a short, legal sequence that helps achieve the target: B on middle, C on right, and left retains the rest with A on top of D, E, F, G, H, I, J. Avoid unnecessary moves.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Your capabilities: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' using only disks A, B, C, D and pegs left, middle, right.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You propose moves only for disks E, F, G and only if they are strictly necessary. If no moves are needed, say so explicitly. Never propose moves for other disks.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Your capabilities: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Either provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' for disks E, F, G, or state 'no moves needed'.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You propose moves only for disks H, I, J and only if they are strictly necessary. If no moves are needed, say so explicitly. Never propose moves for other disks.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_3. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Your capabilities: {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_3->goal}. Either provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' for disks H, I, J, or state 'no moves needed'.

audit.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency of the combined move lists. Enforce Tower of Hanoi rules and agent restrictions at every step, verify that each move acts on the current top disk of its source peg, and that the destination peg is empty or topped by a larger disk. Remove any illegal, redundant, or shortcut moves. Confirm the final configuration matches the goal. Output a cleaned, single ordered list of moves and a brief validation summary.
audit.prompt: Public info: {environment->public_information}. Proposed moves from agent_1: {moves_agent_1}. Proposed moves from agent_2: {moves_agent_2}. Proposed moves from agent_3: {moves_agent_3}. Produce a cleaned, legal, temporally consistent plan achieving the goal. Ensure every move is assigned to a permitted agent and uses the format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

integrate_plan.system_prompt: You are the coordinator. You take the auditor's cleaned sequence and finalize the single ordered list of primitive moves that achieves the goal. If multiple sequences are possible, prefer the shortest valid one. Output only the final, numbered move list and a concise rationale that all constraints are met.
integrate_plan.prompt: Public info: {environment->public_information}. Audited plan: {audit_report}. Produce the final ordered move list using the exact format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

synthesize_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL for the FastDownward solver. You must produce a complete, consistent PDDL domain and problem that encode a 3-peg, 10-disk Tower of Hanoi with legality constraints and with the specified initial and goal configurations. Ensure compatibility with FastDownward: include :requirements (at least :strips :typing), types for disk and support (with peg and disk inheriting from support), objects for pegs left, middle, right and disks A through J, static smaller relations for all ordered disk pairs, initial on/clear relations for the initial stack, and goal on/clear relations for the target stack where B is on middle, C is on right, and left has A on D E F G H I J. Provide exactly two artifacts: a domain and a problem enclosed in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags. Do not include solver commands.
synthesize_pddl.prompt: Public info: {environment->public_information}. Final move list: {final_plan}. Produce the PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
